content.description: Figure 1. Testosterone movement across the cellular membrane
content.question: Testosterone is a small steroid hormone that is important in cell signaling. Which of the following describes where testosterone enters a cell and why it is able to cross at that point?

choices.label: 1, testosterone is nonpolar and can diffuse through the membrane.
2, testosterone covalently binds to a surface protein and transports into the cell.
3, testosterone dissolves in water and flows through the channel.
4, testosterone is filtered out of the extracellular fluid and taken into the cell by endocytosis.

content.answer: 1, testosterone is nonpolar and can diffuse through the membrane.
